TestDescription.name: PHP session.use_only_cookies disabled
TestDescription.Description: When use_only_cookies is disabled, PHP will pass the session ID via the URL. This makes the application more vulnerable to session hijacking attacks. Session hijacking is basically a form of identity theft wherein a hacker impersonates a legitimate user by stealing his session ID. When the session token is transmitted in a cookie, and the request is made on a secure channel (that is, it uses SSL), the token is secure.
TestDescription.Recommendation: You can enabled session.use_only_cookies from php.ini or .htaccess.[break][break][bold]php.ini[/bold][break]session.use_only_cookies = 'on'[break][break][bold].htaccess[/bold][break]php_flag session.use_only_cookies on[break]
